com.google.android.agera

Interface ActivationHandler


  • public interface ActivationHandler
    Receives events of the UpdateDispatcher created with Observables.updateDispatcher(ActivationHandler) when the first Updatable is added and the last Updatable is removed.

    Typically an Observable service implemented using a UpdateDispatcher only needs to be updated if it has clients of its own. By starting to listen to updates from its clients on observableActivated(com.google.android.agera.UpdateDispatcher) and stopping on observableDeactivated(com.google.android.agera.UpdateDispatcher), the service of the service can implement an active/inactive lifecycle, saving memory and execution time when not needed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void observableActivated(UpdateDispatcher caller)
      Called when the the caller changes state from having no Updatables to having at least one Updatable.
      void observableDeactivated(UpdateDispatcher caller)
      Called when the the caller changes state from having Updatables to no longer having Updatables.

    • Method Detail

      • observableActivated

        void observableActivated(UpdateDispatcher caller)
        Called when the the caller changes state from having no Updatables to having at least one Updatable.

      • observableDeactivated

        void observableDeactivated(UpdateDispatcher caller)
        Called when the the caller changes state from having Updatables to no longer having Updatables.
